text: Seeing a tuna chased by a dolphin, he fled in great horror. As he was about to be caught, the force of his jump threw him, unwittingly, over the shore. Driven by the same impulse, the dolphin also ended up in the same place. The tuna turned and saw the dolphin exhaling its last breath. "I don't care if I die", he said, "because I see the cause of my death dying with me". We suffer less from the misfortunes shared with the cause.
title: El atún y el delfín
author: nan Esopo
